title: Calories in an Artichoke Heart
meta_description: Discover calories in an artichoke heart, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks.
assumptions: One medium canned artichoke heart, drained (â‰ˆ24 g), plain, no added oil or marinade; based on boiled/cooked globe artichoke data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, fresh vs. canned, preparation, and brand; sodium higher in brined products. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One artichoke heart provides ~13 kcal, with good fiber and low fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Marinated in oil (add 1 tsp oil per heart)
Fresh boiled heart (vs. canned, lower sodium)
With added butter (1/2 tsp per heart)

faqs.q: How many calories in an artichoke heart?
faqs.a: About 13 kcal for one medium canned, drained heart.

faqs.q: Is an artichoke heart low carb?
faqs.a: Yes, ~2.9 g carbs per heart, with 1.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: What's the fiber in one artichoke heart?
faqs.a: Approximately 1.4 g dietary fiber, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Do artichoke hearts have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low: 0.7 g protein and 0.1 g fat per heart.

faqs.q: How does canning affect artichoke heart calories?
faqs.a: Minimal calorie change, but increases sodium; fresh boiled similar at ~13 kcal.
